combat-range-overlay.no-good-tiles: No tiles are within movement range AND attack range
combat-range-overlay.no-good-area: Nowhere is within movement range AND attack range
combat-range-overlay.show-turn-order-hint: Show combatant turn orders relative to the active token
combat-range-overlay.show-potential-targets-hint: Circle potential targets; color indicates how many actions of movement to reach target
combat-range-overlay.show-difficult-terrain-hint: Draw an overlay on top of difficult terrain (Only works for GM currently if Terrain Mapper < v0.3.0)
combat-range-overlay.show-walls-hint: Draw an overlay on top of all walls
combat-range-overlay.ic_visibility-hint: When should the overlay be visible during combat?
combat-range-overlay.ooc_visibility-hint: When should the overlay be visible out of combat?
combat-range-overlay.vision-masking-type-hint: How should visibility affect the overlay?
combat-range-overlay.vision-masking-percentage-hint: How much of a tile should be visible to be shown?
combat-range-overlay.terrain-measure-hint: How is the terrain of a square is determined?

terrain-measure-types.fivePoint: Majority of five points determine terrain

combat-range-overlay.ranges-hint: Comma-separated list of ranges to choose from in the quick settings dialog

diagonals.name: Diagonals distance
diagonals.hint: How to calculate diagonal movement distance

combat-range-overlay.default-weapon-range-hint: What is the default weapon range?
combat-range-overlay.supported-actors-hint: Comma separated list of actor types for which the overlay should show
combat-range-overlay.recursions-hint: How deeply should the overlay recurse in gridless mode? Higher is more accurate but might cause performance issues
combat-range-overlay.recursion-limited-hint: Should the recursion depth be limited? This should be fine to leave off, but could cause performance issues on less powerful machines

controls.cant-open-no-selected-token: Can't open quick settings without a selected token
controls.cant-reset-no-token: Can't reset token position without a selected token

combat-range-overlay.activated-not-visible: The Combat Range Overlay is now activated but is not yet visible (see Settings for details)
combat-range-overlay.show-weapon-range-hint: Annotate selected token with current weapon range
combat-range-overlay.speed-attr-path-hint: Advanced: Set this only if you're using a System that can't autodetect token Speed
combat-range-overlay.update-position-in-combat-hint: When off, the overlay will not automatically update upon movement in combat
combat-range-overlay.actions-shown-hint: The number of actions to show on the overlay
combat-range-overlay.token-speed-warning-gm: I can't autodetect token speed; please manually set your token's speed and/or set the Speed Attribute in the module settings (and maybe open an issue to add support for your System)
combat-range-overlay.token-speed-warning-player: Please manually set your token's speed (and maybe ask your GM to configure the Speed Attribute in the module settings)

showOverlay.name: Show overlay
showOverlay.hint: Will show the overlay when held if the show on hotkey setting is on

quickSettings.name: Quick settings
quickSettings.hint: Will bring up the override panel if held when clicking the overlay control button

resetMeasureFrom.name: Reset active token
resetMeasureFrom.hint: Will reset the active token if held when clicking the overlay control button

no-actions.name: No action colour
no-actions.hint: The colour that will be used to colour spaces/targets that can be reached in no actions

one-action.name: One action colour
one-action.hint: The colour that will be used to colour spaces/targets that can be reached in one action

two-actions.name: Two action colour
two-actions.hint: The colour that will be used to colour spaces/targets that can be reached in two actions

three-actions.name: Three action colour
three-actions.hint: The colour that will be used to colour spaces/targets that can be reached in three actions

four-actions.name: Four action colour
four-actions.hint: The colour that will be used to colour spaces/targets that can be reached in four actions

weapon-one.name: Weapon one colour
weapon-one.hint: The colour that will be used to highlight spaces that targets can be reached from by weapon one

weapon-two.name: Weapon two colour
weapon-two.hint: The colour that will be used to highlight spaces that targets can be reached from by weapon two

weapon-three.name: Weapon three colour
weapon-three.hint: The colour that will be used to highlight spaces that targets can be reached from by weapon three

combat-range-overlay.multiple-terrain-providers: Multiple modules providing terrain data are active. Please make sure only one is enable to allow Combat Range Overlay to use terrain data.

basic-usage.body: Click to toggle the Overlay on and off. Once the Overlay is enabled, it should Just Workâ„¢ with little to no interaction from you. If your system is supported, your weapon range and speed should be automatically detected. Otherwise, it assumes your weapon has a range of 5 feet (configurable in settings); shift-click the button to change it for your currently selected token. Normally the Overlay will reread your position at the end of your combat turn; control-click the button to force the Overlay to reposition. This is also configurable in settings. Display preferences are available in the module's Settings page.
basic-usage.heading: Basic Usage
basic-usage.alt: Button showing two figures with a horizontal double-headed arrow connecting them

legend.alt: A screenshot of several tokens with the overlay active and numbers corresponding to the following legend.
legend.title: Legend
legend.heading: Understanding the Overlay
legend.assumes: The overlay in this image assumes a movement speed of 15ft/action and a weapon range of 10ft.
legend.1: Tiles tinted blue can be reached in a single action.
legend.2: Tiles tinted yellow can be reached in 2 actions.
legend.3: Enemies circled in white can be attacked without moving.
legend.4: Enemies circled in blue can be attacked in a single move.
legend.5: Enemies circled in yellow can be attacked with 2 moves.
legend.6: Enemies circled in red require 3 or more movements to attack.
legend.7: All tokens (other than the selected token) in combat are annotated with their initiative order relative to the current token.
legend.8: The selected token is annotated with the currently selected weapon range.

targeting.alt: A close up of the previous screenshot focusing on one player and two enemies. One enemy is now targeted and the squares within both movement and weapon range are highlighted.
targeting.title: Targeting
targeting.single-target: If a target is selected, tiles in your movement range **and** in range of the target will be highlighted in white, and only tiles on the shortest path to the highlighted squares will remain tinted.
targeting.multiple-targets: If multiple targets are selected, only tiles in range of **all** targeted enemies will be highlighted.
targeting.no-good-targets: If there's no way to hit all targeted enemies at once, the Overlay will display a warning and act as if no enemies are targeted.
